creator: Armando Bermudez Martinez
document.title: Pilot Dataset Publication, First DOI from DESY Public Data
document.abstract: This dataset is part of an initial test of DESY Public Data integration with DataCite for DOI minting.
document.dataDescription: This dataset is part of an initial test of DESY Public Data integration with DataCite for DOI minting. Dataset description: This is a compiled dataset of raw X-ray reflectivity (XRR, reflectometry) measurements together with corresponding fit parameters, intentionally published to use as training or test data for machine learning models. (The authors aim to include NR data in further versions of this dataset and plan to include other substrates and materials for XRR. Contributions welcome!)

datasets.description: This is a compiled dataset of raw X-ray reflectivity (XRR, reflectometry) measurements together with corresponding fit parameters, intentionally published to use as training or test data for machine learning models. (The authors aim to include NR data in further versions of this dataset and plan to include other substrates and materials for XRR. Contributions welcome!)
datasets.datasetName: Reflectometry curves (XRR and NR) and corresponding fits for machine learning

creator: Chen Shen
document.title: Comparison of pseudo XRR and XRR from conventional reflectometry: water
document.abstract: measurement from the same water surface using GIXOS and conventional reflectometry. Pseudo reflectivity (pseudo XRR) is derived from GIXOS data using the extended Capillary Wave Model, with the exact same rectangular slit setting of the reflectometry and taking into account how reflectivity background is subtracted. Data was measured at the OPLS endstation of the beamline 12ID-SMI, NSLS-II of the Brookhaven National Laboratory.
document.dataDescription: measurement from the same water surface using GIXOS and conventional reflectometry. Pseudo reflectivity (pseudo XRR) is derived from GIXOS data using the extended Capillary Wave Model, with the exact same rectangular slit setting of the reflectometry and taking into account how reflectivity background is subtracted. Data was measured at the OPLS endstation of the beamline 12ID-SMI, NSLS-II of the Brookhaven National Laboratory.

datasets.creationLocation: Brookhaven National Laboratory / National Synchrotron Light Source II / 12ID-SMI / Open Platform Liquid Surfaces (OPLS)

creator: Chen Shen
document.title: Comparison of pseudo reflectivity with the reflectivity from conventional reflectometry
document.abstract: Grazing incidence X-ray off-specular scattering (GIXOS) data and the reflectivity (XRR) from conventional reflectometry are measured on the same sample surfaces: pure water, and DSPC monolayer on water. Pseudo XRR is derived from the GIXOS data using the extended Capillary Wave Model, that taken into account the analysis of the bending modulus from the diffuse scattering data. Moreover, the pseudo XRR derivation has also used the same reflectometry slit settings, and taken into account the way how reflectometry background is subtracted. Both the water surface free of bending rigidity and the DSPC with 20kT bending modulus show excellent agreement between the pseudo XRR and the conventional XRR. These datasets enter the publication of the extended Capillary Wave Model that is under review on the 15th of July, 2025.
document.dataDescription: Grazing incidence X-ray off-specular scattering (GIXOS) data and the reflectivity (XRR) from conventional reflectometry are measured on the same sample surfaces: pure water, and DSPC monolayer on water. Pseudo XRR is derived from the GIXOS data using the extended Capillary Wave Model, that taken into account the analysis of the bending modulus from the diffuse scattering data. Moreover, the pseudo XRR derivation has also used the same reflectometry slit settings, and taken into account the way how reflectometry background is subtracted. Both the water surface free of bending rigidity and the DSPC with 20kT bending modulus show excellent agreement between the pseudo XRR and the conventional XRR. These datasets enter the publication of the extended Capillary Wave Model that is under review on the 15th of July, 2025.

creator: Chen Shen
document.title: grazing incidence off-specular scattering data and verification of pseudo reflectivity method with extended Capillary Wave Model: first measurements
document.abstract: first verification measurements of the pseudo reflectivity method with extended capillary wave model (eCWM): water, water / ethanol mixture, and a few lipid monolayers with bending rigidity on aqueous surfaces (DPPC, DPPG, DPPE, DSPC). They are measured by grazing incidence off-specular scattering experiments (GIXOS) with single exposure. GIXOS data are analyzed with eCWM to get the bending modulus, intrinsic structure factor, and pseudo reflectivity. This means that the full surface normal structure factor and reflectivity can be obtained under a fixed incident angle with one exposure. Comparison of pseudo reflectivity to the reflectivity measured by conventional angle scanning reflectometry on the same sample is perform on water and DSPC monolayer on water.
document.dataDescription: first verification measurements of the pseudo reflectivity method with extended capillary wave model (eCWM): water, water / ethanol mixture, and a few lipid monolayers with bending rigidity on aqueous surfaces (DPPC, DPPG, DPPE, DSPC). They are measured by grazing incidence off-specular scattering experiments (GIXOS) with single exposure. GIXOS data are analyzed with eCWM to get the bending modulus, intrinsic structure factor, and pseudo reflectivity. This means that the full surface normal structure factor and reflectivity can be obtained under a fixed incident angle with one exposure. Comparison of pseudo reflectivity to the reflectivity measured by conventional angle scanning reflectometry on the same sample is perform on water and DSPC monolayer on water.

creator: Chen Shen
document.title: grazing incidence off-specular scattering data and verification of pseudo reflectivity method with extended Capillary Wave Model: POPC monolayer
document.abstract: Pseudo reflectivity of POPC monolayer at water surface (pi = 35mN/m). It is measured by grazing incidence off-specular scattering experiments (GIXOS) with single exposure and analyzed with the extended Capillary Wave Model (eCWM) to get the bending modulus, intrinsic structure factor, and pseudo reflectivity. This is a fluid monolayer.
document.dataDescription: Pseudo reflectivity of POPC monolayer at water surface (pi = 35mN/m). It is measured by grazing incidence off-specular scattering experiments (GIXOS) with single exposure and analyzed with the extended Capillary Wave Model (eCWM) to get the bending modulus, intrinsic structure factor, and pseudo reflectivity. This is a fluid monolayer.
